title: Functional Outcome in Patients With Primary Intracerebral Hemorrhage (FUNC) Score
description: Identifies patients with intracerebral hemorrhage (ICH) who will achieve functional independence at 90 days and aids in clinical decision-making and goals of care discussions.

parameters.name: ich_volume
parameters.description: Volume of intracerebral hemorrhage on initial CT scan

parameters.name: age
parameters.description: Patient age at time of ICH

parameters.name: glasgow_coma_scale
parameters.description: Glasgow Coma Scale score on admission

parameters.name: pre_ich_cognitive_impairment
parameters.description: Presence of cognitive impairment before the ICH

ranges.interpretation: No patients in this group achieved functional independence (GOS ≥4) at 90 days. Consider comfort care measures and discussion of goals of care with family.
Only 13% of all patients (29% of survivors) achieved functional independence at 90 days. Most patients will have severe disability or require full-time care.
42% of all patients (48% of survivors) achieved functional independence at 90 days. Aggressive supportive care may be warranted.
66% of all patients (75% of survivors) achieved functional independence at 90 days. Aggressive supportive care is recommended.
82% of all patients (95% of survivors) achieved functional independence at 90 days. Full supportive care with rehabilitation planning is strongly recommended.

references: Rost NS, Smith EE, Chang Y, Snider RW, Chanderraj R, Schwab K, et al. Prediction of functional outcome in patients with primary intracerebral hemorrhage: the FUNC score. Stroke. 2008 Aug;39(8):2304-9. doi: 10.1161/STROKEAHA.107.512202.

Garrett JS, Zarghouni M, Layton KF, Graybeal D, Daoud YA. Validation of clinical prediction scores in patients with primary intracerebral hemorrhage. Neurocrit Care. 2013 Dec;19(3):329-35. doi: 10.1007/s12028-013-9926-y.
formula: FUNC Score = ICH Volume points + Age points + ICH Location points + GCS points + Pre-ICH Cognitive Impairment points
notes: For use in primary intracerebral hemorrhage only (not for subarachnoid hemorrhage or other types)
Should be calculated at initial ICH diagnosis, not for continuous monitoring
Functional independence defined as Glasgow Outcome Score ≥4 at 90 days
Deep locations include basal ganglia, thalamus, and internal capsule
Infratentorial locations include brainstem and cerebellum
